```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
require(dplyr)
```

```{r}
set.seed(1234)
n <- 10000
p <- 7
treat <- sample(0:1, n, replace = T)
# create the covariates such that they are normalized
Xi <- matrix(NA,n,p)

Xi[,1] <-  rbinom(10000,1,0.52) # Gender
Xi[,2] <- ifelse(Xi[,1] == 1, rnorm(n,185,10),rnorm(n,165,10)) # Weight
Xi[,3] <- rnorm(n,50,5)# Age
Xi[,4] <- Xi[,2]/7 + 2 + rnorm(n) # BMI
Xi[,5] <- (rnorm(n,5,1)) # Tumor Size
Xi[,6] <- rbinom(10000, 1, 0.7) # HBP
Xi[,7] <- rbinom(10000,1,(Xi[,5]-min(Xi[,5]))/(max(Xi[,5])-min(Xi[,5]))) # Relapse

X_mat <- cbind(rep(1, n),Xi)

# Parameters 
# beta - vector of slopes for the 5 covariates to generate Y
beta <- rnorm(p+1, 0,1)
# vector of slopes for the 5 covariates to generate tau
gamma <- rnorm(p+1, 0, 0.5)

tau <- X_mat%*%gamma 
Y1 <- X_mat%*%beta + tau + rnorm(n, 0, 1)
Y0 <- X_mat%*%beta + rnorm(n,0,1)

mean(Y1) - mean(Y0)

colnames(X_mat) = c('beta0','Gender','Weight', 'Age', 'BMI', 'Size_Tumor', 'HBP', 'Relapse')
```

```{r}
researchData <- data.frame(X_mat,treat,Y = ifelse(treat == 1,Y1,Y0)) %>% select(-beta0)
godData <- data.frame(X_mat,treat,Y1,Y0) %>% select(-beta0)
```
